symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc
symbols.description:
The SAPUI5 library that contains the metadata-driven controls and other entities.

SAP Internal This library is restricted to use by SAP internal projects only.

experimental.text: Disclaimer: Usage Restrictions: The components of this library are under development and documented as private. Their APIs are subject to change and should not be used in productive scenarios without further agreement. A general availability of sap.ui.mdc will be announced via the usual channels.

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc.Chart
nodes.description: The Chart control creates a chart based on metadata and the configuration specified.

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc.ChartNew
nodes.description: The Chart control creates a chart based on metadata and the configuration specified.

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc.Field
nodes.description: The Field control is used to bind its value to data of a certain data type.

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar
nodes.description: The FilterBar control is used to display filter properties in a user-friendly manner to populate values for a query.

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc.FilterBarDelegate
nodes.description: Base Delegate for FilterBar.

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc.FilterField
nodes.description: The FilterField control is used to filter data based on the conditions.

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc.Link
nodes.description:
A Link control can be used to handle navigation scenarios with one or more targets through direct navigation or by opening a sap.ui.mdc.link.Panel.
It can also be used to display additional content, such as sap.ui.mdc.link.ContactDetails on the sap.ui.mdc.link.Panel.

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc.LinkDelegate
nodes.description: Base delegate for sap.ui.mdc.Link.

properties.name: p13nMode
properties.description:
Specifies the personalization options available for the chart.

Controls the visibility of the chart tooltip. If set to true , an instance of sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizTooltip will be created and shown when hovering over a data point.

Since: 1.86.

properties.description:
Defines the sort conditions.

Note: This property is exclusively used for handling flexibility changes. Do not use it for anything else.

The vizProperties

properties.description: Defines the width of the chart.

associations.name: filter

Control or object which enables the chart to do filtering, such as sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar. Also see sap.ui.mdc.IFilter.

Since: 1.78.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.condition.Operator
symbols.description:
Creates an sap.ui.mdc.condition.Operator object. This is used in the FilterField control to define which filter operators are supported.

If a function or property is initial, the default implementation is used.

parameters.name: oConfiguration
parameters.description: Properties of the operator

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the operator used in the condition

parameters.name: filterOperator
parameters.description: The operator's default filter operator that is created as defined in FilterOperator

parameters.name: tokenParse
parameters.description: The string representation of the regular expression that is used by the operator to parse a value to eliminate the operator and get the data string. A placeholder that refers to the translated tokenText can be used. #tokenText# refers to the oConfiguration.tokenText property if given.

parameters.name: tokenFormat
parameters.description: The string representation that is used by the operator to format a value into an output string. For the value placeholder {0} and {1} are used. A placeholder that refers to the translated tokenText can be used. #tokenText# refers to the oConfiguration.tokenText property if given.

parameters.name: valueTypes
parameters.description:
Array of type to be used. The length of the array defines the number of values that need to be entered with the operator.
If set to Operator.ValueType.Self the Type of the Field or FilterField using the Operator is used.
If set to Operator.ValueType.Static a simple string type is used to display static text.
If set to a name of a data type an instance of this data type will be used.
If set to an object with the properties name, formatOptions and constraints an instance of the corresponding data type will be used.

parameters.name: paramTypes
parameters.description: Array of type parameters regexp

parameters.name: longText
parameters.description:
String representation of the operator as a long text.
If longText is not given , it is looked up in the resource bundle of the sap.ui.mdc library by the key operators.{oConfiguration.name}.longText

parameters.name: tokenText
parameters.description:
String representation of the operator as a short text.
If the token text is not given, it is looked up in the resource bundle of the sap.ui.mdc library by the key operators.{oConfiguration.name}.tokenText

parameters.name: displayFormats
parameters.description: Pattern how different displayFormats are rendered

parameters.name: validateInput
parameters.description: If set, the user input for this operator needs to be validated using a field help

parameters.name: additionalInfo

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.BaseType
symbols.description:
Enumeration of the possible basic data types

In Field and FilterField different data types can be used. This data types might be model dependent. To handle them model independent internally basic types are used.

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.BaseType.Boolean
properties.description: Data type represents a boolean

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.BaseType.Date
properties.description: Data type represents a date

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.BaseType.DateTime
properties.description: Data type represents a date with time

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.BaseType.Numeric
properties.description: Data type represents a number. (This can be integer, float or any other numeric type.)

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.BaseType.String
properties.description: Data type represents a string

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.BaseType.Time
properties.description: Data type represents a time

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.BaseType.Unit
properties.description: Data type represents a unit. This means a composite type with a number and a unit part is used.

symbols.title: enum sap.ui.mdc.enum.BaseType

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.ConditionValidated
symbols.description:
Enumeration of the validated state of conditions

If a Condition is chosen from a field help or validated against a field help it is set to be validated. In this case the corresponding item in the field help is shown as selected.

If the validated state of the Condition is undefined this means it is not defined if it is validated or not.

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.ConditionValidated.NotValidated
properties.description: Condition is not validated

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.ConditionValidated.Validated
properties.description: Condition is validated

symbols.title: enum sap.ui.mdc.enum.ConditionValidated

properties.description: Field or FilterField is rendered in disabled mode

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.EditMode.Display
properties.description: Field or FilterField is rendered in display mode

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.EditMode.Editable
properties.description: Field or FilterField is rendered in editable mode

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.EditMode.EditableDisplay
properties.description: If more then one control is rendered by the Field or FilterField control, the first part is editable, and the other parts are in display mode.

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.EditMode.EditableReadOnly
properties.description: If more then one control is rendered by the Field or FilterField control, the first part is editable, and the other parts are read-only.

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.EditMode.ReadOnly
properties.description: Field or FilterField is rendered in read-only mode

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.FieldDisplay
symbols.description:
Defines the output of a Field or FilterField control.

For the Field control it defines how the value and additionalValue properties are formatted.

For the FilterField control it defines how key and description of equal conditions are formatted.

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.FieldDisplay.Description
properties.description: Only the description is displayed

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.FieldDisplay.DescriptionValue
properties.description: The description and the value (key) are displayed in the field. The value (key) is displayed after the description in brackets.

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.FieldDisplay.Value
properties.description: Only the value (key) is displayed

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.FieldDisplay.ValueDescription
properties.description: The value (key) and the description are displayed in the field. The description is displayed after the value (key) in brackets.

symbols.title: enum sap.ui.mdc.enum.FieldDisplay

properties.description: The value in the OutParameter element is always set

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.PersistenceMode
symbols.description: Enumeration of the preferred persistence mode for personalization changes.

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.PersistenceMode.Auto
properties.description: Personalization changes are created and implicitly persisted only in case no additional VariantManagement control reference could be found. If a sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement has been found, it will be used instead.

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.PersistenceMode.Global
properties.description: Personalization changes are created in the flexibility layer using ignoreVariantManagement: true

properties.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.PersistenceMode.Transient
properties.description: Personalization changes are not persisted

symbols.title: enum sap.ui.mdc.enum.PersistenceMode

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.Field
symbols.description: The Field control is used to bind its value to data of a certain data type. Based on the data type settings, a default control is rendered by the Field. For example, if a date type is used, a DatePicker is rendered.

properties.name: additionalValue
properties.description:
The additional value of the field.

To display the key and the description in one field, the description must be set on the additionalValue property.

properties.name: value
properties.description:
The value of the field.

To display the key and the description in one field, the key must be set on the value property.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new Field.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: change

parameters.name: value
parameters.description:
The new value of the Field.

If a FieldHelp is assigned to the Field, the value is used as key for the FieldHelp items.

parameters.name: valid
parameters.description: Flag that indicates if the entered value is valid

parameters.name: promise
parameters.description:
Returns a Promise for the change. The Promise returns the value if it is resolved. If the change event is synchronous, the promise has already been already resolved. If it is asynchronous, it will be resolved after the value has been updated.

The Field should be set to busy during the parsing to prevent user input. As there might be a whole group of fields that needs to be busy, this cannot be done automatically.

Since: 1.69.0.

events.description:
This event is fired when the value property of the field is changed by user interaction.

Note This event is only triggered if the used content control has a change event.

methods.name: attachChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.mdc.Field itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the change event of this sap.ui.mdc.Field.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.mdc.Field itself.

This event is fired when the value property of the field is changed by user interaction.

Note This event is only triggered if the used content control has a change event.

methods.name: detachChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the change event of this sap.ui.mdc.Field.

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

symbols.description: This class represents a type that is used to map an array of conditions to a single-value control (such as Input or Text control).

parameters.name: oFormatOptions
parameters.description: Formatting options

parameters.name: valueType
parameters.description: Type of the value of the condition (used for formatting and parsing)

parameters.name: operators
parameters.description: Possible operators to be used in the condition

parameters.name: display
parameters.description: DisplayFormat used to visualize value

parameters.name: fieldHelpID
parameters.description: ID of the field help, to determine key and description // TODO: async request????

parameters.name: hideOperator
parameters.description: If set, only the value of the condition is shown, but no operator //TODO

parameters.name: maxConditions
parameters.description: Maximum number of allowed conditions

parameters.name: bindingContext
parameters.description: BindingContext of field. Used to get key or description from the value help using in/out parameters. (In table, the value help might be connected to different row)

parameters.name: originalDateType
parameters.description: Type used on field. E.g. for date types internally a different type is used internally to have different formatOptions

parameters.name: isUnit
parameters.description: If set, the type is used for the unit part of a field

parameters.name: getConditions
parameters.description: Function to get the existing conditions of the field. Only used if isUnit is set. TODO: better solution

parameters.name: asyncParsing
parameters.description: Callback function to tell the Field the parsing is asynchronous.

parameters.name: navigateCondition
parameters.description: Condition of keyboard navigation. If this is filled, no real parsing is needed as the condition has already been determined. Just return it

parameters.name: delegate
parameters.description: Field delegate to handle model-specific logic

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Payload of the delegate

parameters.name: preventGetDescription
parameters.description: If set, description is not read by formatValue as it is known that no description exist or it might be set later

parameters.name: conditionModel
parameters.description: ConditionModel, if bound to one

parameters.name: conditionModelName
parameters.description: Name of the ConditionModel, if bound to one

parameters.name: defaultOperatorName
parameters.description: Name of the default Operator

parameters.name: oConstraints
parameters.description: Value constraints

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.field.DefineConditionPanel
symbols.description: A DefineConditionPanel control is used inside the ValueHelpPanel control to enter different types of conditions.

properties.name: conditions
properties.description:
Sets the conditions that represent the selected values of the help.

Since: 1.62.0.

properties.name: formatOptions
properties.description:
The formatOptions for the ConditionType used to format tokens.

Since: 1.62.0.

properties.name: inputOK
properties.description:
If set, there has been no invalid user input.

Note: This property must not be set from outside. It is a property because that way it can be bound to the ManagedObjectModel of the calling field help and automatically update it.

Since: 1.87.0.

properties.name: label
properties.description:
The label for the DefineConditionPanel used as panel headerText.

Since: 1.84.0.

aggregations.name: _content
aggregations.description:
Optional content that can be rendered.

Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType as type.

If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType as type.

Warning: Only controls allowed in a Form are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the sap.ui.core.IFormContent interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

properties.description:
Sets the ARIA attributes added to the inner control.

The object contains ARIA attributes in an aria node. Additional attributes, such as role, autocomplete or valueHelpEnabled, are added on root level.

properties.name: _fieldHelpEnabled
properties.description: Internal property to bind the showValueHelp property of the internal Input control.

properties.name: conditions
properties.description:
Sets the conditions that represent the values of the field.

This should be bound to a ConditionModel using the corresponding fieldPath.

Note: For FilterField controls, the conditions property must be used to bind FilterField to a ConditionModel.
For example, for a FilterField control inside a FilterBar control the binding looks like this:
conditions="{$filters>/conditions/propertyPath}" with the following data:

  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • propertyPath as the property name

For an Any (see sap.ui.model.FilterOperator) FilterField control, the binding looks like this:
conditions='{$filters>/conditions/navPath*/propertyPath}' with the following data:

  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • navPath#42;/ as the navigation property name
  • propertyPath as the property name
Between navPath and propertyPath, */ is required.

Note: A condition must have the structure of ConditionObject.

properties.name: dataType
properties.description: The type of data handled by the field. This type is used to parse, format, and validate the value.

properties.name: dataTypeConstraints
properties.description: The constraints of the type specified in dataType.

properties.name: dataTypeFormatOptions
properties.description: The format options of the type specified in dataType.

properties.name: delegate
properties.description:
Path to FieldBaseDelegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. Once the required module is associated, this property might not be needed any longer.

Since: 1.72.0.

properties.name: display
properties.description: Defines whether the value and/or description of the field is shown and in what order.

properties.name: editMode
properties.description: Determines whether the field is editable, read-only, or disabled.

properties.name: label
properties.description:
Defines the label text for the field.

This can be used by FilterBar or Form controls to create a Label control for the field.

Since: 1.62.0.

properties.name: maxConditions
properties.description:
Sets the maximum amount of conditions that are allowed for this field.

The default value of -1 indicates that an unlimited amount of conditions can be defined.

Note If the data type used doesn't support multiple conditions, an error is thrown.

properties.name: multipleLines
properties.description:
If set, the Field is rendered using a multi-line control.

This property only affects types that support multiple lines.

Note If the data type used doesn't support multiple lines an error is thrown.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description:
Defines a short hint intended to aid the user with data entry when the control has no value. If the value is null no placeholder is shown.

Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored.

properties.name: required
properties.description: Indicates that user input is required.

properties.name: showEmptyIndicator
properties.description:
If set, an empty Field renders an empty-indicator in display mode.

This property only takes effect if editMode is set to Display.

Note Empty means the Field holds no value. If an empty string is a valid value, the Field might show nothing, depending on the display settings and assigned description or FieldHelp.

Since: 1.85.0.

properties.name: textAlign
properties.description:
Defines the horizontal alignment of the text that is shown inside the input field.

Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description:
Defines the text directionality of the input field, for example RTL, LTR.

Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description:
Visualizes the validation state of the control, for example Error, Warning, Success.

Note: The visualization of the ValueState property is handled by the inner rendered control. If a control is set (using content, contentEdit, or contentDisplay), this control needs to support the valueState behavior, otherwise valueState is not visualized.

properties.name: valueStateText
properties.description: Defines the text that appears in the value state message pop-up. If this has not specified, a default text from the resource bundle is shown.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines the width of the control.

aggregations.name: _content
aggregations.description: Internal content if no control set from outside.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description:
Optional content that can be rendered.

Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using ConditionsType as type.

If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using ConditionType as type.

Warning: Only controls allowed in a Form are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the IFormContent interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

aggregations.name: contentDisplay
aggregations.description:
Optional content to be rendered if the editMode property is set to Display.

Note: If a control is assigned to the content aggregation, this one is ignored.

Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using ConditionsType as type.

If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using ConditionType as type.

Warning: Only controls allowed in a Form are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the IFormContent interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

Since: 1.61.0.

aggregations.name: contentEdit
aggregations.description:
Optional content to be rendered if the editMode property is not set to Display.

Note: If a control is assigned to the content aggregation, this one is ignored.

Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using ConditionsType as type.

If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using ConditionType as type.

Warning: Only controls allowed in a Form are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the IFormContent interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

Since: 1.61.0.

aggregations.name: fieldInfo
aggregations.description:
Optional FieldInfo used for detail information. This is only active in display mode.

Note: If a special data type is defined or a content control is set, this is ignored.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs that label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

associations.name: fieldHelp
associations.description:
Optional FieldHelp.

This is an association that allows the usage of one FieldHelp instance for multiple fields.

Note: If the field is inside of a table, do not set the FieldHelp instance as dependent to the field. If you do every field instance in every table row gets a clone of it. Put the FieldHelp instance e.g. as dependent on the table or page. The FieldHelp instance must be somewhere in the control tree, otherwise there might be rendering or update issues.

Note: For Boolean fields, no FieldHelp should be added, but a default FieldHelp used instead.

Default value is Editable.

Defines the label text for the field.

This can be used by FilterBar or Form controls to create a Label control for the field.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: setMaxConditions

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: iMaxConditions
parameters.description: New value for property maxConditions

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property maxConditions.

Sets the maximum amount of conditions that are allowed for this field.

The default value of -1 indicates that an unlimited amount of conditions can be defined.

Note If the data type used doesn't support multiple conditions, an error is thrown.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is -1.

methods.name: setMultipleLines

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bMultipleLines
parameters.description: New value for property multipleLines

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property multipleLines.

If set, the Field is rendered using a multi-line control.

This property only affects types that support multiple lines.

Note If the data type used doesn't support multiple lines an error is thrown.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setPlaceholder

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sPlaceholder
parameters.description: New value for property placeholder

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property placeholder.

Defines a short hint intended to aid the user with data entry when the control has no value. If the value is null no placeholder is shown.

Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is empty string.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setShowEmptyIndicator

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowEmptyIndicator
parameters.description: New value for property showEmptyIndicator

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property showEmptyIndicator.

If set, an empty Field renders an empty-indicator in display mode.

This property only takes effect if editMode is set to Display.

Note Empty means the Field holds no value. If an empty string is a valid value, the Field might show nothing, depending on the display settings and assigned description or FieldHelp.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

methods.name: setTextAlign

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.description: New value for property textAlign

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property textAlign.

Defines the horizontal alignment of the text that is shown inside the input field.

Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is Initial.

methods.name: setTextDirection

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sTextDirection
parameters.description: New value for property textDirection

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property textDirection.

Defines the text directionality of the input field, for example RTL, LTR.

Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is Inherit.

methods.name: setValueState

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sValueState
parameters.description: New value for property valueState

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property valueState.

Visualizes the validation state of the control, for example Error, Warning, Success.

Note: The visualization of the ValueState property is handled by the inner rendered control. If a control is set (using content, contentEdit, or contentDisplay), this control needs to support the valueState behavior, otherwise valueState is not visualized.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is None.

methods.description:
Determines the description for a given key.

This function is called while formatting the output of a Field or FilterField control in case a description is to be displayed but only a key is given.

If this needs to be determined asynchronously, a Promise is returned.

As the key might change (uppercase), an object with key and description can be returned.

If the description cannot be determined, a corresponding FormatException is thrown.

returnValue.description: Object containing description, key, in and out parameters. If it is not available right now (must be requested), a Promise is returned.

parameters.name: oPayload
parameters.description: Payload for delegate

parameters.name: oFieldHelp
parameters.description: Field help assigned to the Field or FilterField control

parameters.description: Value as entered by user

parameters.description: Value parsed by data type to fit the data type of the key

parameters.description: BindingContext of the checked field. Inside a table the FieldHelp element might be connected to a different row.

parameters.name: bCheckKeyFirst
parameters.description: If set, it first should be checked if the value fits a key

parameters.name: bCheckKey
parameters.description: If set, it should be checked if there is an item with the given key. This is set to false if the value cannot be a valid key because of type validation.

parameters.name: bCheckDescription
parameters.description: If set, it should be checked if there is an item with the given description. This is set to false if only the key is used in the field.

parameters.name: oConditionModel
parameters.description: ConditionModel, if bound to one

parameters.name: sConditionModelName
parameters.description: Name of the ConditionModel, if bound to one

methods.description:
Determines the key, description, and the in and out parameters of a user input.

If this needs to be determined asynchronously, a Promise is returned.

The result needs to be an object containing the following properties: description, key, and in and out parameters.

  • key: Key of the item
  • description: Description of the item
  • inParameters: Object with in parameters and the corresponding value
  • outParameters: Object with out parameters and the corresponding value

If the item cannot be determined, a corresponding ParseException is thrown.

symbols.description: Base type for the FieldHelp association in the FieldBase controls.

properties.name: conditions
properties.description:
The conditions of the selected items.

Note: This property must only be set by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

Note: A condition must have the structure of ConditionObject.

properties.name: delegate
properties.description: Defines the module path of the metadata delegate.

properties.name: filterValue
properties.description:
The value by which the help is filtered.

Note: This only takes effect if the FieldHelp element supports filtering.

Note: This property must only be set by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

properties.name: validateInput
properties.description:
If this property is set, the user input is validated against the field help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error occurs.

If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the field help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.)

Since: 1.69.0.

methods.name: getValidateInput

returnValue.description: Value of property validateInput

methods.description:
Gets current value of property validateInput.

If this property is set, the user input is validated against the field help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error occurs.

If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the field help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.)

Default value is true.

methods.name: getValueHelpEnabled

returnValue.description: If set, value help text needs to be rendered

methods.description:
Checks if a "valueHelp enabled" text should be rendered for screenreader.

If a complex value help exists on a field a corresponding text needs to be read out by screen readers. For simple "combobox" cases this is not needed. So this depends on the specific value help.

Delegate class for sap.ui.mdc.base.FieldHelpBase.

methods.description:
Requests the content of the field help.

This function is called when the field help is opened or a key or description is requested.

So, depending on the field help control used, all content controls and data need to be assigned. Once they are assigned and the data is set, the returned Promise needs to be resolved. Only then does the field help continue opening or reading data.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelp
symbols.description: A field help used in the FieldHelp association of controls based on FieldBase that shows a value help dialog.

properties.name: _enableOK
properties.description: Internal property to bind the OK button to enable or disable it.

properties.name: delegate
properties.description: Defines the module path of the metadata delegate.

properties.name: descriptionPath
properties.description: The path of the description field in the content binding. If a table is used as content, this is the binding path of the description of the items.

properties.name: filterFields
properties.description:
The fields based on which the table data is filtered. For filtering the value of the filterValue property is used.

If set to $search and the used binding supports search requests, a $search request is used for filtering.

If set to one or more properties, the filters for these properties are used for filtering. These filters are set on the ListBinding used. The properties need to be separated by commas and enclosed by "*" characters. ("*Property1,Property2*")

If it is empty, no suggestion is available.

properties.name: keyPath
properties.description:
The path of the key field in the content binding. If a table is used as content, this is the binding path of the key of the items.

If not set, the FieldPath of the assigned field is used.

properties.name: noDialog
properties.description:
If set, the field help doesn't open a value help dialog, but just displays the content. It behaves like in the case of a suggestion but without any search.

Since: 1.60.0.

properties.name: showConditionPanel
properties.description:
Determines if a condition panel is shown.

Since: 1.60.0.

properties.name: title
properties.description:
Title text that appears in the dialog header.

Since: 1.60.0.

aggregations.name: _dialog
aggregations.description: internal dialog

aggregations.name: _filterBar
aggregations.description:
Internal FilterBar control of the field help. (If no external FilterBar used.)

Since: 1.86.0.

aggregations.name: collectiveSearchItems
aggregations.description:
Items for collective searches.

If used, a field to switch value helps will be shown. If the value help is switched, the contentRequest function of the delegate is called and the chosen key is provided.

Note: Icons are not supported.

Since: 1.87.0.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description:
Content of the field help.

To support different types of content (for example sap.m.Table), a specific wrapper is used to map the functionality of the content control to the field help. The content control is assigned to the wrapper.

The filter logic must be implemented in the wrapper control. The filtering is triggered by user interaction (type-ahead, search request, or search from FilterBar). (If FilterBar is in LiveMode and in parameters are used, this also triggers filtering.)

Since: 1.60.0.

aggregations.name: dialogContent
aggregations.description:
Content for dialog.

To support different types of content (for example sap.m.Table), a specific wrapper is used to map the functionality of the content control to the field help. The content control is assigned to the wrapper.

The filter logic must be implemented in the wrapper control. The filtering is triggered by user interaction (type-ahead, search request, or search from FilterBar). (If FilterBar is in LiveMode and in parameters are used, this also triggers filtering.)

Note: If no special content for the dialog is provided, the content of the content aggregation is used.

Since: 1.88.0.

aggregations.name: filterBar
aggregations.description:
FilterBar control of the field help.

Since: 1.60.0.

aggregations.name: inParameters
aggregations.description:
Sets the in parameters of a field help.

If set, the field help reads the data of these entities in the model and uses it to filter in the value help.

Since: 1.66.0.

aggregations.name: outParameters
aggregations.description:
Sets the out parameters of a field help.

If set, the fields sets the data of these entities in the model based to the selected values.

Since: 1.66.0.

aggregations.name: suggestContent
aggregations.description:
Content for suggestion.

To support different types of content (for example sap.m.Table), a specific wrapper is used to map the functionality of the content control to the field help. The content control is assigned to the wrapper.

The filter logic must be implemented in the wrapper control. The filtering is triggered by user interaction (type-ahead, search request, or search from FilterBar). (If FilterBar is in LiveMode and in parameters are used, this also triggers filtering.)

Note: If no special content for suggestion is provided, the content of the content aggregation is used.

Since: 1.88.0.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new FieldValueHelp.

If a more complex value help is needed, the application can add a table to this field help. As the behavior depends on the used table control in this case, a wrapper is used between the used control and the FieldValueHelp element.

Note: If a FieldValueHelp element is connected to a field, it gets the BindingContext of this field. So the in and out parameters are done in this context. Therefore bind the content table in such a way that that it finds its data also in the BindingContext of the field.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: dataRequested
events.description:
This event is fired when a description for a key or a key for a description is requested, and no data table with list binding is assigned.

This is the case if a Field or FilterField shows the description of the value. and the value is formatted or a new input is parsed.

Since: 1.67.0.

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the dataRequested event of this sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelp.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelp itself.

This event is fired when a description for a key or a key for a description is requested, and no data table with list binding is assigned.

This is the case if a Field or FilterField shows the description of the value. and the value is formatted or a new input is parsed.

methods.name: getCollectiveSearchItems
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation collectiveSearchItems.

Items for collective searches.

If used, a field to switch value helps will be shown. If the value help is switched, the contentRequest function of the delegate is called and the chosen key is provided.

Note: Icons are not supported.

methods.name: getContent
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation content.

Content of the field help.

To support different types of content (for example sap.m.Table), a specific wrapper is used to map the functionality of the content control to the field help. The content control is assigned to the wrapper.

The filter logic must be implemented in the wrapper control. The filtering is triggered by user interaction (type-ahead, search request, or search from FilterBar). (If FilterBar is in LiveMode and in parameters are used, this also triggers filtering.)

methods.name: getDelegate

returnValue.description: Value of property delegate

methods.description:
Gets current value of property delegate.

Defines the module path of the metadata delegate.

Default value is ...see text or source.

methods.name: getDescriptionPath

returnValue.description: Value of property descriptionPath

methods.description:
Gets current value of property descriptionPath.

The path of the description field in the content binding. If a table is used as content, this is the binding path of the description of the items.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getDialogContent
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation dialogContent.

Content for dialog.

To support different types of content (for example sap.m.Table), a specific wrapper is used to map the functionality of the content control to the field help. The content control is assigned to the wrapper.

The filter logic must be implemented in the wrapper control. The filtering is triggered by user interaction (type-ahead, search request, or search from FilterBar). (If FilterBar is in LiveMode and in parameters are used, this also triggers filtering.)

Note: If no special content for the dialog is provided, the content of the content aggregation is used.

methods.name: getFilterBar
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation filterBar.

FilterBar control of the field help.

methods.name: getFilterFields

returnValue.description: Value of property filterFields

methods.description:
Gets current value of property filterFields.

The fields based on which the table data is filtered. For filtering the value of the filterValue property is used.

If set to $search and the used binding supports search requests, a $search request is used for filtering.

If set to one or more properties, the filters for these properties are used for filtering. These filters are set on the ListBinding used. The properties need to be separated by commas and enclosed by "*" characters. ("*Property1,Property2*")

If it is empty, no suggestion is available.

Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getInParameters
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation inParameters.

Sets the in parameters of a field help.

If set, the field help reads the data of these entities in the model and uses it to filter in the value help.

methods.name: getKeyPath

returnValue.description: Value of property keyPath

methods.description:
Gets current value of property keyPath.

The path of the key field in the content binding. If a table is used as content, this is the binding path of the key of the items.

If not set, the FieldPath of the assigned field is used.

Default value is empty string.

Default value is false.

To support different types of content (for example sap.m.Table), a specific wrapper is used to map the functionality of the content control to the field help. The content control is assigned to the wrapper.

The filter logic must be implemented in the wrapper control. The filtering is triggered by user interaction (type-ahead, search request, or search from FilterBar). (If FilterBar is in LiveMode and in parameters are used, this also triggers filtering.)

Note: If no special content for suggestion is provided, the content of the content aggregation is used.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelpContentWrapperBase
symbols.description: Base type for FieldValueHelp content control wrapper.

properties.name: selectedItems
properties.description:
The selected items.

An item is an object with the properties key, description, inParameters and outParameters.

Note: This property must only be set by the FieldValueHelp element, not by the application.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new FieldValueHelpContentWrapperBase.

The FieldValueHelp element supports different types of content. To map the content control API to the FieldValueHelp element, a wrapper is needed. This base class just defines the API.

Note: All events and functions must only be used by the corresponding field help.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: dataUpdate

parameters.name: contentChange
parameters.description: If set, the content control has changed. If not set, only the data has changed

events.description:
This event is fired when the data of the field help is changed.

This is needed for the FieldValueHelp element to update the popup or dialog. This might be needed to trigger an update for formatting a key with its description in the connected field.

events.name: navigate

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The navigated key

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The navigated description

parameters.name: leave
parameters.description:
true if there is navigation away from content (for example, from a table)

In this case the field should get the focus.

parameters.name: disableFocus
parameters.description: Disable initial popover focus

parameters.name: itemId
parameters.description:
The ID of the navigated item

This is the DOM reference needed for ARIA support to point to the navigated item.

Since: 1.81.0.

events.description: This event is fired when content is navigated.

events.name: selectionChange

parameters.name: selectedItems
parameters.description:
Array of selected items

Each item is represented as an object with the properties key, description, inParameters and outParameters.

parameters.name: itemPress
parameters.description:
Indicator of item is chosen via press or enter or via a selection

Depending of the field help logic the field help needs to be closed on click, but not on multi-selection. (If a Table is used, clicking an item in the suggestion closes it bit activation the check box not.)

since: 1.76.0

events.description: This event is fired after a selection has been changed.

methods.name: applyFilters

parameters.name: aFilters
parameters.description: Filter objects

parameters.name: sSearch
parameters.description: Search string (for $search request)

methods.description:
Applies the entered filters and search string to the content control (table).

As the way how filters and search are applied depends on the ListBinding and the used content control, this needs to be done in the wrapper.

If the ListBinding in the wrapper is suspended, it must be resumed in this function after setting the filters. It will not be resumed in the FieldValueHelp element. There applyFilters is only called if the filters should really be set.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelpMTableWrapper
symbols.description: Wrapper to use a sap.m.Table control as content of a FieldValueHelp element

aggregations.name: table
aggregations.description:
Table of the field help.

As the FieldValueHelp element cannot know the semantic of the items, the caller is responsible for the item handling. The items must be active to allow interaction and selection.

This can be handled automatically if the following applies:

  • No keyPath or descriptionPath is specified for the FieldValueHelp element
  • Table has no paging
  • Table uses ColumnListItem as item
  • The first column if the table contains the key and the second column the description, using a Text control

For everything else the application has to implement the logic.

If the ListBinding of the table is initially created to be suspended, no filtering or selection is triggered. So the table is empty. Upon user interaction (type ahead, search request, or search from FilterBar) the ListBinding is resumed so the filter is executed. If FilterBar is in LiveMode, and InParameters are used, this also triggers filtering.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.field.ListFieldHelp
symbols.description: A field help used in the FieldHelp association of controls based on FieldBase that shows a list of items.

properties.name: filterList
properties.description:
If set, the items of the list are filtered based on filterValue.

If a type-ahead behavior for the connected field is wanted, this property must be set to true. For small lists all values are meant to be shown, independent of the typing in the connected field. In this case this property must be set to false.

If not set, the list opens if the user clicks into the connected field.

Since: 1.81.0.

properties.name: useFirstMatch
properties.description:
If set, getKeyForText returns the first item that matches the text.

This is the case if the text of the item starts with the text entered.

Since: 1.81.0.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description:
Items of the field help.

The key of the items is not shown in the list, but is used as a value of the connected field.

If the additionalText for all the items is not used, the column will not be displayed.

Note: At the moment, icons are not supported.

Note: If ListFieldHelpItem elements are used as items, the items are grouped and sorted by the value provided in the groupKey property of the item. The value provided in the groupText property will be shown as group header.

parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar
symbols.description:
The FilterBar control is used to display filter properties in a user-friendly manner to populate values for a query. The filters are arranged in a logical row that is divided depending on the space available and the width of the filters. The Go button triggers the search event, and the Advanced Filters button shows the filter dialog.
The FilterBar control creates and handles the filters based on the provided metadata information. The metadata information is provided via the FilterBarDelegate implementation. This implementation has to be provided by the application.

Note: If the liveMode property is set to true, it is ignored.

Defines the path to the metadata retrieval class for the FilterBarBase control. It basically identifies the FilterBarDelegate file that provides the required APIs to create the filter bar content.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Note: This property must not be bound.

Since: 1.74.

properties.description:
Specifies the filter conditions.
Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is used exclusively for SAPUI5 flexibility. Do not use it otherwise.

Since: 1.66.0.

properties.name: liveMode
properties.description:
Triggers a search automatically after a filter value has been changed.
Note: The liveMode property only operates in non-mobile scenarios.
Additionally, if the liveMode property is active, the following applies:
The error message box is not displayed, and the showMessages property is ignored.

Since: 1.74.

properties.name: showGoButton
properties.description:
Determines whether the Go button is visible in the filter bar.
Note: If the liveMode property is set to true, it is ignored.

properties.name: showMessages
properties.description:
Displays possible errors during the search in a message box.

Since: 1.74.

properties.name: suspendSelection
properties.description:
If set to true, all search requests are ignored. Once it has been set to false, a search is triggered immediately if one or more search requests have been triggered in the meantime but were ignored based on the setting.

Since: 1.79.0.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.FilterField
symbols.description: The FilterField control is used to filter data based on the conditions. The conditions are managed in the corresponding ConditionModel. That is why the conditions property must be bound to the related conditions in the ConditionModel. The type of this data must be defined in the dataType property.

properties.name: defaultOperator
properties.description:
Default operator name for conditions. If empty, the relevant default operator depending on the data type used is taken.

Note: The defaultOperator can be the name of an Operator or the instance itself.

Since: 1.88.0.

properties.name: operators
properties.description:
Supported operator names for conditions.

If empty, default operators depending on used data type are used.

Since: 1.73.0.

Conditions of the field. This includes all conditions, not only the changed ones.

Since: 1.61.0.

parameters.name: promise
parameters.description:
Returns a Promise for the change. The Promise returns the value if it is resolved. If the change event is synchronous, the promise has already been already resolved. If it is asynchronous, it will be resolved after the value has been updated.

The FilterField should be set to busy during the parsing to prevent user input. As there might be a whole group of fields that needs to be busy, this cannot be done automatically.

Since: 1.69.0.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.Link
symbols.description:
A Link control can be used to handle navigation scenarios with one or more targets through direct navigation or by opening a sap.ui.mdc.link.Panel.
It can also be used to display additional content, such as sap.ui.mdc.link.ContactDetails on the sap.ui.mdc.link.Panel. Note: Navigation targets are determined by the implementation of a sap.ui.mdc.LinkDelegate.

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc.mixin.AdaptationMixin
nodes.description: Enhances a given control prototype with consolidated handling for adaptation.

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc.mixin.DelegateMixin

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc.mixin.FilterIntegrationMixin
nodes.description:
Enhances a given control prototype with consolidated handling for external IFilter integration

The following methods are available:

  • setFilter - The setter for the filter association
  • _validateFilter - Validates the provided IFilter control instance and may return an error
  • checkAndRebind - Executes a the rebind method for the given control instance.

To use the FilterIntegrationMixin, the implementing Control requires the filter associaton.

Additionally, the following methods are necessary to be implemented:

  • rebind
  • isFilteringEnabled

Hooks that are called by the FilterIntegrationMixin if implemented in the control.

  • _onFilterProvided(oFilter: sap.ui.mdc.IFilter) - Notifies the control that a valid filter association has been provided. The provided filter instance is passed.
  • _onFilterRemoved(oFilter: sap.ui.mdc.IFilter) - Notifies the control that the filter association has been removed. The removed filter instance is passed.
  • _onFiltersChanged(oEvent) - Called when the search event of the filter is fired. The event object is passed.
  • _onFilterSearch(oEvent) - Called when the filtersChanged event of the filter is fired. The event object is passed.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.mixin.AdaptationMixin
symbols.description:
Enhances a given control prototype with consolidated handling for adaptation.

The following methods are available:

  • getEngine - Provides access to the adaptation engine singleton instance.
  • retrieveInbuiltFilter - Provides access to the AdaptationFilterBar initialization
  • getInbuiltFilter - Returns the AdaptationFilterBar instance, if available.
  • getAdaptationConfigAttribute - Returns an adaptationConfig attribute.

Additionally, the following methods are wrapped:

  • exit
symbols.title: namespace sap.ui.mdc.mixin.AdaptationMixin

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.mixin.DelegateMixin
symbols.description:
Enhances a given control prototype with consolidated asynchronous handling for delegate modules and their initialization.

The following methods are available:

  • awaitControlDelegate - Provides access to the delegate initialization Promise.
  • getControlDelegate - Returns the delegate instance, if available.
  • getPayload - Returns the payload object set for the delegate property.
  • getTypeUtil - Returns the typeUtil made available by the delegate module
  • initControlDelegate - Loads and initializes the delegate module related to the enhanced control.
  • initPropertyHelper - Loads and initializes the property helper related to the enhanced control.
  • awaitPropertyHelper - Provides access to the property helper initialization Promise.
  • getPropertyHelper - Returns the property helper instance, if available.

Additionally, the following methods are wrapped:

  • applySettings
  • exit
  • init
  • setDelegate

The prototype.init wrapper creates the following instance fields:

  • bDelegateInitialized - Indicator for the availability of delegates
  • bDelegateLoading - Indicates whether the initialization of delegate modules is triggered but not yet completed (loading necessary)

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: The control instance implementing IxState to retrieve the externalized state

methods.description: Retrieves the externalized state for a given control instance. The retrieved state is equivalent to the "getCurrentState" API for the given Control, after all necessary changes have been applied (e.g. variant appliance and P13n/StateUtil changes). After the returned Promise has been resolved, the returned State is in sync with the according state object of the MDC control (for example "filterConditions" for the FilterBar).

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.p13n.StateUtil
symbols.description: Utility class for state handling of MDC Controls. The StateUtil is offering a generic way to retrieve and apply a desired state to a given MDC Control. The StateUtil class is tightly coupled to the flex integration of MDC Controls, to use Stateutil API's the given MDC Control instance needs to fully enable all available p13nMode options in order for the StateUtil to create the required changes and retrieve the according state of the control.

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.BaseType
nodes.description:
Enumeration of the possible basic data types

In Field and FilterField different data types can be used. This data types might be model dependent. To handle them model independent internally basic types are used.

nodes.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.ConditionValidated
nodes.description:
Enumeration of the validated state of conditions

If a Condition is chosen from a field help or validated against a field help it is set to be validated. In this case the corresponding item in the field help is shown as selected.

If the validated state of the Condition is undefined this means it is not defined if it is validated or not.
